result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy L Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tammy L Ward is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tammy L Ward was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Due to financial hardship, Court ordered all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges be set up to $300.00 Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but is waived. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" for victims of domestic violence counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy L Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tammy L Ward in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Tammy L Ward in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of the probation agent, the 9/25/15 probation review is rescheduled to 11/06/15 at 1:30 pm.  rmm

Defendant Tammy L Ward in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Micha Schwab, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" for victims of domestic violence counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Due to financial hardship, Court ordered all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges be set up to $300.00  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but is waived.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Rebecca W. received and filed.  rmm
from Gregory Rothstein received and filed.  rmm

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed.  As to Count 2 as amended:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief recieved and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Tammy L Ward in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered the Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer in Count 2 dismissed.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine received and filed.

Defendant Tammy L Ward in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/04/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
In addition to previous conditions, Court ordered defendant maintain absolute sobriety.
Statements made by Brian R.  Court modified the no contact order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Tammy L Ward in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
to Modify Bail received and filed.  rmm
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brian R.

Defendant Tammy L Ward in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Tammy L Ward in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY. Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.D
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
